summary: A memorandum from the Bureau of Prisons Regional Director to the Warden of MCC New York, notifying of an After Action Review team's arrival to investigate the apparent suicide of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. It lists the team members and requests logistical support from the facility staff.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the After Action Review, identified as an inmate who died by apparent suicide at MCC New York.

events.title: After Action Review Team Arrival
events.description: A team of Bureau of Prisons staff arrives at MCC New York to begin an investigation into the apparent suicide of Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The document is a formal notification of an After Action Review into Jeffrey Epstein's death at MCC New York.
The review is described as investigating an 'apparent suicide' of inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-054).

The review team includes personnel from various BOP roles and facilities, including a Regional Director, Correctional Services Administrator, Health Services Administrator, Chief Psychologist, Correctional Programs Administrator, Associate Warden, and a Captain.
The memorandum emphasizes the need for facility staff cooperation, including IT support for accessing videos and electronic records.
The document advises the warden to notify the local union, indicating potential labor relations considerations during the investigation.
